results.title: Battle for Australia
results.creator_credit: Jean King and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: I have vivid memories of watching the Army march along Swanston Street, fit and tanned with heads held high, wearing the famous slouch hat. Jean King’s husband was a navy salvage diver during World War II, and she shares her experiences of being the wife of a war veteran as well as the toll the war took on families and the returned after the war

results.title: Battle beyond the sun
results.creator_credit: Alexander Kozyr, Francis Ford Coppola and American International Pictures (AIP)
results.brief_description: Roger Corman and future super director Francis Ford Coppola (using the pseudonym Thomas Colchart), are behind this sci-fi adventure of two warring hemispheres competing to be the first on Mars. Instead, they end up lost and landing in a small store where monsters (suspiciously shaped like male and female genitalia) constantly battle it out. The bulk of the scenes come from the Soviet sci-fi adventure Nebo Zovyot, which Corman had purchased a few years before. He dropped the cold-war aspects and assigned young Coppola to rewrite, edit and produce the film. Music by Les Baxter.

results.title: Battle angel Alita
results.creator_credit: Hiroshi Fukutomi, Yuji Takae, Masao Maruyama, K.S.S., Shueisha, Business Jump and Yukito Kishiro
results.brief_description: Battle Angel Alita is a tough, modern fable investigating the increasingly blurred boundaries between humans and machines. The earth of the future is a decaying dystopia, populated by gladiator cyborgs, ruthless hunter-warriors, and anyone else unfit to gain entry to Zarem, an exclusive off-world haven for the wealthy and socially elite. While foraging through the rubbish, gifted cyborg scientist Dr. Ido discovers the remains of a centuries-old cyborg. Back at his lab, he rebuilds her, and names her Alita. Unable to recall her past, Alita strives to understand the world around her, making friends with the ambitious Yugo and becoming entangled in his dream to buy entrance to Zarem. She decides to assist Yugo after a chance encounter with a hostile cyborg reveals her extraordinary powers, and registers herself as a hunter-warrior, in order to obtain some fast money. However, when one of Yugo’s get- rich-quick schemes backfires, The Factory place a bounty on his head, forcing him to take desperate measures to keep his dream alive. The drama that unravels as a result gives Alita a painful insight into the deepest desires that drive the human world. Based on the successful graphic series by Yukito Kishiro, this feature film merges two episodes from the original Japanese release: Gunnm - Rusty angel’ andGunnm - Tears sign’.

results.title: Battered women: violence behind closed doors
results.creator_credit: Christina Crowley, J. Gary Mitchell and J Gary Mitchell Film Company
results.brief_description: Examines the problem of wife beating and points out new methods of police intervention in cases of domestic violence. Includes interviews with abusive men and victimised women, encouraging women to speak out and seek protection from violent husbands.

results.title: Batsmen (S)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Gillman, David Puttnam and Visnews Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Benson and Hedges golden greats of cricket”.
A comprehensive history of the game of cricket tracing the games’ development from the early nineteenth century to the present. The first part examines the careers of the most reknowned of international cricket batsmen including W. G. Grace, George Headley, Leonard Hutton, Bradman, Kapi Dev, Clive Lloyd, Ian Botham and Viv Richards. The video uses archival and television footage from the largest cricket and/or media libraries in the world.

results.title: Bats, birds and bionics
results.creator_credit: John MacDonald, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Demonstrates the application of the principles of natural systems in living animals such as bats, rattlesnakes, frogs and rats, to engineering devices to guide blind persons, self guiding missiles, photoelectric scanners capable of distinguishing shapes and bionic computers designed to learn and to control man-like robots. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Bats
results.creator_credit: Louis Morneau, Louise Rosner, Brad Jenkel and Destination Films
results.brief_description: Dr Sheila Casper (Dina Meyer), a respected zoologist and her assistant Jimmy are called to Gallup, Texas, following a high incidence of bat attacks. She find this news bizarre, as bats usually avoid all contact with humans. Arriving in town she meets local sheriff, Emmett Kinsey (Lou Diamond Phillips), who confirms that aggressive bats are responsible for the attacks. Together they discover that the bats have been genetically altered by local mad scientist, Doctor Alexander McCabe (Bob Gunton), under instruction by the U.S. Government. When the town is attacked by a swarm of bats, it is up to Casper and Kinsey to track down the bat’s cave and stop them before they wreak havoc on another town.

results.title: Baton Rouge
results.creator_credit: Rachid Bouchareb, Jean-Pierre Mahot and Humbert Balsan
results.brief_description:
Baton Rouge’ is the story of three friends, one Frenchman, Mozart, and two Beurs (see footnote), Karim and Abdenour, who dream of travelling to Baton Rouge in pursuit of the American Dream (inspired by a Mick Jagger song). After a series of sequences set in the suburbs of Paris, introducing the characters, and showing them doing various temporary jobs, a whimsical twist of fate allows the threesome to make their dream come true. The plot follows their adventures in the United States as they journey south to Louisiana. Although they encounter obstacles aplenty, and are forced by lack of money into bumming train rides or stealing from a garage, they also bathe in the warmth of a more tolerant atmosphere than they have come to expect in France.” Reference: “Questions of identity in Beur cinema: from ‘Tea in the Harem’ to ‘Cheb’”. Screen 34:4 (Winter 1993): pp 321-342. Footnote: The word Beur is derived from Parisian backslang for ‘arabe’ (Arab), and was in circulation within the immigrant community in the late 1970s. Its hybrid form reflects the conflict of identity experienced by the newly visible ‘second generation’ (as they are still called).

Credits: Producers, Humbert Balsan, Jean-Pierre Mahot ; director, Rachid Bouchareb ; writers, Rachid Bouchareb, Jean-Pierre Ronssin ; photography, Jimmy Glasberg, Pierre Dupouey ; music, John D. Faure.
Cast: Jacques Penot, Pierre-Loup Rajot, Hammou Graia, Elaine Foster, Romain Bouteille, Katia Tchenko.

results.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
results.brief_description: Fearing the actions of a god-like Super Hero left unchecked, Gotham City’s own formidable, forceful vigilante takes on Metropolis’s most revered, modern-day savior, while the world wrestles with what sort of hero it really needs. And with Batman and Superman at war with one another, a new threat quickly arises, putting mankind in greater danger than it’s ever known before.

constellations_other.name: Cinema to superheroes
constellations_other.description: This Magnaphonic Projector and its double were originally used in the Tallangatta cinema in the 1930s.

results.title: Batman Unmasked: The Psychology of the Dark Knight
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2008
results.brief_description: Delve into the world of Batman and the vigilante justice that he brought to the city of Gotham. Batman is a man who, after experiencing great tragedy, devotes his life to an ideal—but what happens when one man takes on the evil underworld alone? Examine why Batman is who he is—and explore how a boy scarred by tragedy becomes a symbol of hope to everyone else.
